results.title: Yugoslavia; Hungary
results.creator_credit: William Fitzwater, Fitzwater Productions and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Depicts the experiences of Australian children of various ethnic backgrounds in the country where their parents were born. “Yugoslavia”: Duska Franic discovers her large extended family when visiting her parents’ birthplace in the beautiful Croatian countryside. “Hungary”: Debbie Karp journeys to Budapest, her mother’s birthplace. She visits relatives and tours Hungary on a voyage of discovery.

results.title: Jessie Thandi in India; Ellen Youie in China = India; China
results.creator_credit: William Fitzwater, Stephen Cross, Fitzwater Productions, Argosy Films and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Two programs from the series” Through Australian Eyes”. In the first program Australian-born Jessie Thandi journeys to the Punjab region of India, her father’s place of birth in a search for her own identity. In the second program Ellen Youie visits the small Cantonese village where her mother was born, and strengthens the ties she feels with her Chinese heritage.
results.title_for_label: Jessie Thandi in India; Ellen Youie in China = India; China
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Fitzwater, Stephen Cross, Fitzwater Productions, Argosy Films and Channel 0\28

results.title: Rosemary Agostino in Italy; Angela Sarantis in Greece
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Barinder Productions and Channel 0-28
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Two programs from the series :Through Australian eyes”. In the first program Rosemary Agostino returns to her parents’ birthplace in Calabria. In the small village she becomes aware of the sense of community missing from life in Australia. In the second program Angela Sarantis returns to her father’s village in Kastraki in northern Greece. She sees that many changes have occurred since her parents left their homeland particularly due to the demands of Greece’s main industry, tourism.

group_works.title: 20 Things to make and do = 20 fun things to make and do
group_works.creator_credit: Rob Sheerlock, Ian Richardson, Graham Peach, John Harry, James Lingwood, NWS Channel 9 (Adelaide, S. Aust.) and Science Craft

results.title: 20 Things to make and do = 20 fun things to make and do
results.creator_credit: Rob Sheerlock, Ian Richardson, Graham Peach, John Harry, James Lingwood, NWS Channel 9 (Adelaide, S. Aust.) and Science Craft
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Deane and Rob’s Curiosity Show collection”.
Deane Hutton and Rob Morrison from “The Curiosity Show” present twenty of their favourite activities. By following the step-by-step instructions viewers can make twenty different toys and games, using materials readily available around the house.

results.title: Energy transfer devices
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Topics”.
Steam and diesel, and high speed electric trains are all studied as examples of energy transfer, concentrating on electricity generation. A plea for solar-based energy is made.

results.title: Electronics in action
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Topics”.
Through simple diagrams and explanations this film illustrates the role of valves, transistors, IC’s, oscillators, filters, amplifiers and microprocessors in basic electronics and discusses their application in computers, electrical appliances, sound recording and medical diagnosis.
